newsitem.title: JAPAN: JGBs to test downside, support seen at 123.35.
newsitem.headline: JGBs to test downside, support seen at 123.35.

text.p: Key March Japanese government bond futures are likely to make a try for the downside on Monday, following a sharp fall in the yen versus the dollar overseas.
The yen's fall versus the dollar may continue to weaken Tokyo share prices, and such falls could have a negative impact on JGBs, a trader for a city bank's securities affiliate said.
The March, however, is likely to find solid support at 123.35, which would be the lowest level for a benchmark futures contract since November 11, the trader said.
"JGBs are unlikely to fall below 123.35, especially since there will only be a half-day of trade today," he said.
The Tokyo JGB market will be closed on Monday afternoon. Regular full-day trade will resume on Tuesday.

Investors are unlikely to move aggressively ahead of a 10-year JGB auction expected to take place on Thursday, traders said. The coupon rate is likely to be either 2.7 percent or 2.8 percent, they said.

Although investors would prefer a coupon rate of three percent or above, since a sudden rise in JGB yields to such levels is unlikely, a coupon rate of around 2.7 percent is likely to attract some investors, the trader for the city bank's securities affiliate said.
